intro: Dolichos homblei, commonly known as the African horsebean, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its pods are elongated and contain several seeds, which are often used as a food source in some regions. Dolichos homblei is also valued for its role in agricultural systems due to its ability to improve soil fertility.
